name: Luis Miguel
description:
'''Luis Miguel Gallego Basteri''' ({{IPA|es-419|ˈlwis miˈɣel ɣaˈʝeɣo βasˈteɾi|pron}}; born 19 April 1970)   is a Mexican singer and record producer. Born in [[Puerto Rico]] to parents of Spanish and Italian descent, he is often referred to as "[[Honorific nicknames in popular music|El Sol de México]]" ("The Sun of Mexico"). Luis Miguel has sung in multiple genres and styles, including [[Latin pop|pop]] songs, [[Latin ballad|ballads]], [[bolero]]s, [[Tango (flamenco)|tangos]], [[jazz]], [[big band]], and [[mariachi]]. He is also recognized as the only Latin singer of his generation not to cross over to the [[Anglo]] market during the "Latin Explosion" in the 1990s.

Despite recording in [[Spanish language|Spanish]] and [[Italian language|Italian]], Miguel continued to be the [[List of best-selling Latin music artists|best-selling Latin artist in the 1990s]] and was credited for popularizing the bolero genre within the mainstream market. He has sold around 60 million records worldwide, making him one of the [[List of best-selling Latin music artists|best-selling Latin music artists]].

[[Latin pop|Latin pop music]], along with his personal life and showmanship on stage, has made Miguel popular for nearly his entire career, which started in Mexico in 1981. At the age of 14, he received his first Grammy for his duet "[[Me Gustas Tal Como Eres]]" with [[Sheena Easton]], making him one of the [[Grammy Award milestones|youngest Grammy-winning]] artists in music history. In 1991, the [[Recording Industry Association of America|RIAA]] recognized the success of his 1991 album ''[[Romance (Luis Miguel album)|Romance]]'' as one of the [[List of best-selling Latin albums|best-selling Latin albums of all time]]. He was the first Latino artist to earn two [[RIAA certification|platinum certifications]] for Spanish-language albums in the United States, for ''Romance'' and ''[[Segundo Romance]]'' (the latter earning him 35 platinum records throughout Central and South America). He is also recognized by ''Billboard'' as the artist with the most top-10 hits on [[Hot Latin Songs|''Billboard''{{'}}s Hot Latin Songs]] chart. His album ''[[Cómplices]]'' was released in 2008, peaking at No. 10 on the mainstream [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]]; his most recent album, ''[[¡México Por Siempre!]]'', was released in 2017 and earned him his second number one on the [[Billboard regional Mexican charts|''Billboard'' Regional Mexican Albums]] chart, achieving double-platinum status.

Miguel is also known for his high-grossing, captivating live performances. He is the [[List of highest-grossing concert tours by Latin artists|highest-grossing Latino touring artist]] since Boxscore began tracking touring data in 1990, with a total of $633.1 million, and 6.3 million spectators With the [[Luis Miguel Tour 2023–24]], he visited 20 countries in North America, South America and Europe, where he performed in a year and a half span with a total of 194 shows all over the world, making it the highest-grossing tour ever made by a Latin artist. He also holds the record for the most consecutive presentations in the [[Auditorio Nacional (Mexico)|Auditorio Nacional]] (National Auditorium) with a total of [[México En La Piel Tour|30 consecutive]] concerts, as well as the record for the most presentations in the same venue with a total of 258 concerts. {{as of|2020|10}}, Luis Miguel ranks number two on ''Billboard''{{'}}s Greatest of All-Time Latin Artists chart.
